executiveSummary: Entrepreneurs Ky and Max from Philadelphia pitched their child-safe cardboard cutting tool, the Chompsaw, on Shark Tank seeking $250,000 for 5% equity. After demonstrating the product’s safety and explaining their $2.1M in pre-orders, they accepted a joint offer from Mark Cuban and Lori Greiner for $250,000 in exchange for 15% equity.
keyDecisions: Ky and Max accepted Mark Cuban and Lori Greiner’s joint offer of $250,000 for 15% equity in their company.

actionItems.task: Oversee final production test run of 1,000 Chompsaw units in China
Begin shipping pre-ordered Chompsaw units to customers
Explore retail partnerships once inventory is available

nextSteps: Ky and Max will complete final production and begin shipping orders, while working with Mark and Lori to scale marketing and retail distribution for the Chompsaw.
